title: Any tips on how to enjoy the game a little more?
body: Recently been having the least fun with it since a very long time.

replies.body:
1. Mute assholes
2. Play each match to perform the best you can and learn from it, not to win. If you know you did good and that's what your mission was you will be more accepting of a loss.
3. Try something new. On a whim, work on mastering a different champion and/or a different role, or play a different mode.
Press enter, drag your chat box off the screen. You are welcome

What don't you enjoy about the game?  Are you not having fun with your current role/champion?  Are you on a massive losing streak?  Are you running into a lot of toxic players?  Do you feel like you've plateaued in skill?  Can't help you find something until I know what you've lost.

Been forced to play a lot of Meta champions recently. Always had the most fun with showing people that really outlandish shit can work, was a Sion main before his rework, both AP and AD, also a Taric main with his mana-scaling on-hit passive and an according build or AP Taric, later with his armor scaling on-hit passive, both before his rework. They always were not only really fun builds but also actually viable and often caught people off-guard.

Now I feel like I can't do this as much anymore. Non-Meta champions seem to always underperform and even if they turn out to be decent, trying to learn new champions in a Meta were one single fuck-up will mean that you will have a really bad experience just makes it much harder than before - not that I could do anything about the Meta though. Kinda tired of having to pick Darius all the time.

I've also been maining jungle and toplane for the last few seasons but they are just unrecognizable at this point, they've changed so much over the years and aren't the lanes I grew to love anymore.

Lastly, frustration in general. The game isn't as casual as it used to be, if you don't tryhard and handle all the pressure that you have to deal with these days it's just really hard to have a fun experience. In general, the pace of the game and how unforgiving it is right now is just hard to deal with to the point where it's just really bad for my mental health because they are almost as stressful as work. But yet again, can't really directly change the game itself, right.

Just posting this so that I somehow might find a way to cope with what the game is right now. I grew to love it and have invested a lot of time and money into it, I want to somehow have fun with it again instead of just quitting it after all these years.

I'd agree that the game is more try hard now because everyone's skill is getting higher and higher. What is "silver skill" now was probably closer to "gold skill" in earlier seasons. This is just the natural progression of games. At first everything is random because no one knows how to play and over the course of a couple years people begin to figure out the best strategies.

You can still have fun with off meta builds, you just need good fundamentals to make them work. If you cs well and understand map novement you can beat people even if your build is "sub For example, I recently played quite a bit of attack speed on hit lulu top lane and had a blast with it. However, some builds are never going to be viable so you do need to be more selective.

If you're looking for casual definitely stick with normal games or ARAMS. If someone flames you for playing something off meta just laugh at them and mute them.

Another thing you can do to find a community that has the same priorities as you. I'm sure there are tons of clubs that love to play off meta stuff. Some of my best experiences have been doing stupid stuff in normals while we make fun of each other in discord.

Fuck.
The.
Meta.

Play some full AD Sion Jungle.

I've done it all.
If you enjoy fun builds, use some fun builds.
Mute whoever flames you for it and have some casual ass fucking fun :^)
I'd suggest you play with some friends, that's what I do whenever I play dumb shit like that
